intro: Prosopanche minor, commonly known as the lesser ghostflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in late spring. It grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in association with other desert flora. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
